location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 392: Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, to Commodore John Patterson Porter, Commander of the Indian Naval Squadron in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter acknowledges the receipt of John Patterson Porter's letter of 22 October 1850, which announced the arrival of the HC steam frigate Auckland. Hennell requests that the Aucklandembark on a mission, accompanied by the Tigrisand the Euphrates, to obtain the payment of 600 dollars as the deeah for the two subjects of Sheik Sultan ben Sugger [Sulṭān bin Saqr Āl Qāsimī] who were killed by the people of the Beniyas [Banī Yās] Sheik, on board Himreyah [Al Ḩamrīyah] boats. Hennell requests that the Aucklandreturn to Bushire once the mission is completed, to allow the dispatch of the HC sloop Cliveto Bombay.
